qas.question: Who did Burke write to on Nov 4, 1793?
Which faction's uprising in La Vendee did Burke support?
Who did Burke urge to send reinforcements to La Vendee?
Where did Burke think La Vendee might lead to a march on?
What did Burke support Britain fighting against?
Who wrote to Burke on Nov 4, 1793?
What faction was Burke opposed to in La Vendée?
When did Henry Dundas write to Burke?
Burke considered supporting the war against the revolution as being against which nation?

context: Burke supported the war against <a4_0>revolutionary France<a4_0/>, seeing Britain as fighting on the side of the royalists and émigres in a civil war, rather than fighting against the whole nation of <b9_0>France<b9_0/>. Burke also supported the <a1_0><b6_0>royalist<b6_0/><a1_0/> uprising in La Vendée, describing it on 4 November 1793 in a letter to <a0_0><b5_0>William Windham<b5_0/><a0_0/>, as "the sole affair I have much heart in". Burke wrote to <a2_0>Henry Dundas<a2_0/> on <b7_0>7 October<b7_0/> urging him to send reinforcements there, as he viewed it as the only theatre in the war that might lead to a march on <a3_0>Paris<a3_0/>. Dundas did not follow <b8_0>Burke's<b8_0/> advice, however.
